message.content:
There are several reasons why mold might be growing in your water dispenser. Some of the most common reasons include:

1. High humidity: If you live in an area with high humidity, it is more likely that mold may form inside and around the water dispenser.

2. Residual moisture: Mold thrives in damp environments, so if there is residual moisture within or around your dispenser after use, this can encourage growth.

3. Infrequent cleaning: Regularly cleaning the components of your water cooler helps to limit any build-up of dirt or grime which may promote mold growth.

4. Stagnant water: Mold needs moisture to grow; hence stagnant water left sitting for prolonged periods can increase the risk of mold formation.

5. Contaminated source water: If bacteria or other impurities are present in your source drinking water, they could encourage mold growth when introduced into a new environment like a dispenser reservoir.

To prevent future occurrences of mold growth:
  - Ensure proper ventilation where possible
  - Clean and sanitize all components regularly
  - Empty unused standing/reservoir and allowing it air-dry before refilling
  - Use purified/effective filtered bottled/source-water
